name: Guennewig Hotel Bristol

reviews.text: Have been here before, but its obviously been modernised and upgraded since last time I was there. Extremely comfortable bed, efficient air-conditioning which came in handy because of the muggy weather outside. Very near Bonn railway station, but you wouldn't know it inside (well soundproofed). Great breakfast service, mix of fresh fruits and meats, plus English-style bacon and eggs if you're in the mood. Pleasant, attentive staff. Only minus is the cost of wifi. They should put this into the price of the room.
reviews.title: Great Breakfast in the Heart of Bonn

reviews.text: Located 2 minutes walk from the bus and train stations, and the main shopping area, this remarkably quiet hotel is a real find. Some might say it's old fashioned, but for me, it was charming. Don't get me wrong, I love funky modern hotels, but everything about this place just felt homely and right. It's big, but feels like a family run place, with friendly staff from several generations. My room was spacious, and had everything you might need for a few days away - including decent air-con: a necessity in humid June! Breakfast was fresh, with plenty of choice. Has a swimming pool, but didn't use it. Next time I'm in Bonn, I'd have no qualms about coming back here. Here for business, but would happily bring family.
reviews.title: A real find!

reviews.text: Nicely located hotel, close to the city centre and an easy walk to the university and the Rhine. The staff are very courteous and helpful. I found the bed comfortable. Easy WiFi access to internet (not free).
reviews.title: Nice hotel in convenient central location

reviews.text: My single complaint is that the safe in the room was not wide enough to be able to be able to store my laptop, hence I needed to take my computer with me every time I left the hotel.
reviews.title: Good hotel in good location but Expensive Internet !

reviews.text: It is ideally located close to the railway station and quite possible just to walk across from the station with luggage.
reviews.title: Ideal location near the train station and city center

reviews.text: Walking distance to the train station (and therefore all the buses too). The rooms were very clean. The front desk was very helpful. There was free internet on the lobby computer. The price was very reasonable. The only possible downside is that with the windows open you could hear the trains (but otherwise it was very quiet--not a party neighborhood). It might be better if you get a room at the back of the hotel to avoid train noise. It was walking distance to the market square in the town centre, and to the Rhine. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Needs urgent refurbishment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room on the 4th floor looked as if no single refurbishment was done for 20 years. It smelt awful (like always with very old carpets). Opening windows was not an option since the noisy station is opposite. Service was OK, but not specially friendly. This is really overpriced for this kind of standard and I wonder how it can be a 4-star hotel. Location is pretty central though.
reviews.title: nice hotel -- great deal

reviews.text: Got a "last minute" deal on a very nice non-smoking, king-sized bed, "quiet" room at the Gunnewig. The staff were outstanding: helpful, nice, and always available. The hotel felt new, well appointed without being ostentatious, very clean. Bathroom was a mix between European and American. Big, but w/bidet, towel warmers. Only problem (minor) was the bed. Because I asked for a King (other choice was "double" which one never knows what one will get in Europe) and so we got essentially a combined twin set. Sadly, they did not have the gap covered, so "snuggling" was a bit difficult. Also, the mattresses were rather harder than I like, but we slept great, so it wasn't a huge issue. The other odd thing was the couch & chair in the room were miniature. Like for kids, rather than for adults. But we weren't in the room much, and they weren't uncomfortable, just smaller than normal. We got a great deal on the room, and enjoyed our trip, and I would definitely recommend the hotel, and stay there again, especially if I could get the fantastic price we got.
reviews.title: Old style but really stylish

reviews.text: I stayed here two nights earlier this week, In all I enjoyed my stay but felt ot was definitely not a 4 star hotel even the room tariff was!! the decor and furnishing don't seem to have changed since the 1970's - you would really have to travel far to get another place like it. What was once darkwood panelling in rooms and corridors has been poorly and cheaply painted over in white/cream. An odd shaped cabinet in the bedroom once housed a built in TV. the bathroom had very dated marble tiles but a very effective shower. Pity the place was dusted more carefully - look above the sink in the bathroom in room 714 - dust thick in the overhead panel. Great viewd from 714 though and definitely pick of the room. In summary: dated, needing comprehsive refurbishment, good location, expensive for what it is and no free wifi!
reviews.title: Stepping back to the 1970's

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights and liked it (though we also got lucky in that we got a fairly large corner room). The interior is a bit tired and needs refurbishing soon, but that is about we could complain about. Breakfast was good.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Solid 4 Points

reviews.text: This is a pretty standard german hotel with comfortably firm, single beds for single travelers. It was clean but the internet signal was weaker in rooms farther away from the elevator and requires T-mobile access. The breakfast buffet is typical but altogether this hotel is good value and a very easy walk from the train station. A neutral choice overall; please offer free internet!
reviews.title: Good location good value

description: Hospitality and tradition are the trademarks of the Günnewig Hotel Bristol Bonn. This hotel is located in the heart of the federal city of Bonn, and is in the immediate vicinity of the former government quarter. It stands on the picturesque avenue between two major historical monuments, Poppelsdorfer Castle and the former residence of the elector, today housing part of the University of Bonn. The main train station, the shuttle bus stop to Cologne Airport.
